documentation.text:
@notice Get the user's bank balance
 @return balance The balance of the user

attributes.text:
@notice Get the user's bank balance
 @return balance The balance of the user

devdoc.author: Will Papper and Syndicate Inc.
devdoc.details: Security for the Bank contract is paramount :) You can assume that the owner of the Bank contract is the first account in Ganache (accounts[0] within Bank.js), and that the user of the bank is not the owner of the Bank contract (e.g. the user of the bank is accounts[1] within Bank.js, not accounts[0]).

params.amount: The amount that a fee should be deducted from
The amount that a user wants to deposit

returns._0: balance The balance of the user

params.fee: The fee that bankFee should be set to

returns._0: bankFee The new value of the bank fee

params.amount: The amount that a user wants to withdraw. The bank takes a 0.3% fee on every withdrawal

devdoc.title: A sample bank contract

calculateBankFee(uint256).notice: Calculate the fee that should go to the bank

deposit(uint256).notice: Process a deposit to the bank

setBankFee(uint256).notice: Set the fee that the bank takes

withdraw(uint256).notice: Process a withdrawal from the bank

userdoc.notice: The Bank contract keeps track of the deposits and withdrawals for a single user. The bank takes a 0.3% fee on every withdrawal. The bank contract supports deposits and withdrawals for any ERC-20, but only one ERC-20 token can be used per bank contract.
